Setup Ftp On Aws Centos

  1. Install vsftpd

bash yum install vsftpd - y

  1. Open up the config file

bash vim /etc/vsftpd/vsftpd.conf

  1. Add the following lines to the end of vsftpd.conf

bash pasv_enable=YES pasv_min_port=1400 ← port range to be opened at the security group pasv_max_port=1500 pasv_address=23.21.148.84 ← server IP

  1. Open up the following ports at the security group within AWS

bash 21 ← default FTP connection port 1400-1500 ← passive port range set in vsftpd.con

  1. Restart the vsftpd server

bash sudo service vsftpd restart

  1. Add new user to server for login

bash sudo adduser [username]

  1. Give user a password so they can login

bash sudo passwd [username]

  1. Add entry to auto start vsftpd on server restart

bash sudo chkconfig vsftpd on

  1. Bonus - if you want to have a user’s files uploaded to an EBS mount, symlink from the FTP user’s directory to the EBS mount

bash ln -s [source-file/folder] [link-name]
